intro: Freycinetia mariannensis, commonly known as the Mariana palm, is a flowering plant native to the Mariana Islands. It is a member of the Arecaceae family, characterized by its tall, slender trunk and pinnate leaves. The plant produces inflorescences that bear small, clustered flowers, which are typically greenish in color. Its fruit is a drupe, containing a single seed enclosed in a fleshy outer layer. This species plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for local wildlife.
